reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at this Hotel on Saturday 19th April for my birthday treat (on the Sunday). I cannot fault the facilities, room, staff or the Hotel general areas one bit. Everywhere was spotlessly clean, looked recently decorated, comfortable, welcoming. The bed was excellent, room large and fully equipped, bathroom was huge and immaculate.
reviews.title: Fantastic Birthday Treat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was superb, lots of attentive staff. We went for the Full English option and there was lots to choose from.
reviews.title: An OK stay

reviews.text: I had a great time, thanks to my partner too, and will definitely return one day. I will also have no hesitation in recommending this Hotel to any friends/colleagues I know who are visiting London.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - give it a try!

likes.liked: — The comfort of the room and proximity to transport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must also thank Trip Advisor, as I always check reviews before staying anywhere and they are always very accurate!
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is just average in my opinion. We were given a room with a brick wall out of the single window. If you stood on the bed the view was OK. I do not understand why a hotel would even use this type of location as a guest room. The front desk experience was OK, the breakfast was good, small room, location was acceptable.
reviews.title: fantastic hotel !!!!
Very Comfortable Beds + Large Screen TVs
reviews.text: I stayed at the London Bridge Hotel with my family for a weekend sightseeing visit to London. It is ideally positioned and only 2 minutes walk from London Bridge Station. Must have good insulation as I did not hear the trains at all during my stay. The staff are very friendly and the rooms are quite luxurious with an interior design feel. We stayed in one of the apartments which was really well kitted out with a massive Flat Screen TV and once the kids were in bed we watched a pay movie. (Mission Impossible 3 !). The breakfast was excellent (especially the bacon), and the kids ordered hot chocolate as kids do at 8am !

reviews.title: loved londen bridge
reviews.text: The hotel is a 5 minutes walk away from the London's lovely southbank which provides a really interesting walk.

reviews.title: Great place... enjoy!!!
reviews.text: I would defintely stay here again - but next time it will probably be on business.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i really enjoyed this hotel. The hotel it self it beautiful and unique
reviews.title: great all round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the rooms comes with a huge plasma Tv and a comfortable goose down bed. One of the best hightlight is that the hotel is centrally located near london dungen and London Bridge, with tour bus stops a block away. I really recommend this hotel
reviews.title: superb elegance

reviews.text: Found this hotel on internet, great weekend deals and brilliantly located next to London Bridge Station, easy access to all major attractions. 5star quality for decor, rooms and service. Hotel open 24hrs, rooms were stunning, all mod cons available - had a fantastic stay and breakfast was included in the price - definately would stay again. If you are looking for a luxurious hotel in the heart of London, this is it!
reviews.title: Excellent 5 star hotel, super location!

likes.liked: — The luxurious rooms and location of the hotel
likes.disliked: — Parking the car away from hotel

reviews.text: A great place to stay and i would certainly choose the london bridge hotel for my next trip to london.
reviews.title: A very nice hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms (i stayed on two different occasions) were clean, the staff helpful and friendly, the continental breakfast was sufficient and they even had a nice fruit salad (made with fresh fruit, not the tinned kind), which was a real treat.
reviews.title: Great time

likes.liked: — Central location and the reasonable rate .

reviews.text: The only suggestion i would have with regard to the rooms (and the reason why i am giving a four-star and not a five-star rating) is that they check the mattresses (i am specifically speaking of room 316). The bed had two mattresses and one, i guess the side preferred by most guests, was very noticeably worn out. I did not mind as i had the bed to myself and slept on the other side but it would not have been very nice if there were two people staying in the room and one of them would have had to sleep on the worn out mattress.
reviews.title: WOW what a hotel....
A hotel that understands customer care
reviews.text: But besides that, the london bridge hotel is great value for money (i paid about 70 GBP per night incl. continental breakfast, booked at Skoosh), the location is certainly second to none, the surrounding area is not a hotel hell as you would find in areas such as around earls court or paddington station and everything you need (shops, restaurants) is within easy walking distance.

We had a weekend away with the kids (both under 5) and wasn't sure if this hotel would be suitable but it was fantastic. Had a room with double bed and double sofa bed for kids. Huge plasma tv that swivelled so we could watch it when kids were asleep and vice versa! Never stopped in a hotel where the bed is better than my own but at London Bridge Hotel I did! Very clean and decor is first class. Would definitely stop there again.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I've stopped in

reviews.text: We planned a weekend to celebrate our Ruby Anniversary, and found the London Bridge Hotel ideally situated, near Tube or Train station,with Taxi service near. We had no problems going to places. The bonus being near the Thames River walks, with plenty of landmarks to see or visit.
reviews.title: Ruby Wedding Week-end

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being from the countryside we found London Bridge Hotel, lobby to be small and inviting, so we didn't feel lost at all. We found the staff very helpful and courteous. The rooms clean and the bed comfy. All in all a perfect weekend.
reviews.title: Sleek business hotel with good weekend rates

reviews.text: Martin @ Irene Brixham Devon
reviews.title: Great choice. thanks trip advisor.

likes.disliked: — Very small hotel bar, bars under the hotel closed on Saturday and Sunday.

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights at the London Bridge Hotel in mid-October, in an executive king room. We chose it due to its location (in Southwark, near the Borough Market, Southwark Cathedral, Shakespeare's Globe, etc), and the positive review in the Rough Guide to London.
reviews.title: I loved this hotel!

reviews.text: I have stayed in this hotel a number of times on business and it is a very pleasant place to stay. It is quite a small hotel and so feels very relaxing and personal compared to some of the larger chain hotels in London. The rooms are quite small though that is to be expected for a building of its age. The rooms however are always immaculate. Last time I stayed here they were in the process of renovating the rooms and I have to say if you stay you should request one of the modern rooms - they are really very excellent - the bathrooms are very clean and bright, the bedrooms colours are warming and the the furniture is top class including a wall-mounted wide screen TV!! If modern isnt your thing then they do still have some more classically decorated rooms which are also good.
reviews.title: Good htoel in good location

reviews.text: Breakfast is similarly good and relaxing given that the dining room is small and quaint - the food is fine as well.
reviews.title: Good Location and Very clean (new wing)

reviews.text: Although I stay here on business I would definately recommend it to couples/travellers/tourists etc as it is in a great location, right next to a station and only minutes walk from the river. Great value for money overall considering londons prices.
reviews.title: Absolutely great place!

reviews.text: We have just came home from a Easter weekend stay at The London Bridge Hotel.
reviews.title: Absolutley fantastic
Comfortable hotel with onsite fitness club
reviews.text: We stayed in an Executive Room in the 'new wing'. It was very clean and looked to be recently refurbished. It had a complimentary bottle each of still and sparkling mineral water replaced every day. The king size bed has a very firm mattress and is actually 2 twins joined together - you'd feel the join if you slept in the middle but there's enough room so this is not a problem.

great hotel. I stayed here with my mum for two nights in July this year either side of a holiday to France. Hotel is in great location near London Bridge railway station - but no station noise. Good area to walk around and see the main London sights - River Thames, Tower Bridge etc. We had a good twin room, but when we found that the in room safe was not working we were immediately moved to a more spacious room with many apologies from the hotel staff.
reviews.title: great hotel, good value

likes.liked: — good quality hotel and good rates

reviews.text: Quiet location but handy for taxis at the station. On the first morning of our stay we left very early in order to go on holiday so the hotel gave us a packed breakfast as breakfast was included in our online rate. The next time we stayed we made the most of our included full breakfast which was really nice.
reviews.title: Good hotel - if you get a good room

likes.disliked: — Being lied to about the availability of other rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked online on the hotel website and paid just under £120 for both of us for a nice room with full breakfast.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: I have stayed in London many times through work and this hotel is nicer and less expensive than many others that I have stayed in.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff very friendly. Food at the Georgetown Malaysian Restaurant at the hotel was excellent with friendly service.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the LBH

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted a hotel near to the Old Vic & were delighted to find the rave reviews on tripadvisor for the London Bridge Hotel, especially the quick & easy transport links nearby. We also had an excellent stay there-- from the friendly helpful staff to the comfortable & luxurious accommodation to the lavish feast which was our continental breakfast! We enjoyed a very good Malaysian lunch at the next door restaurant on arrival & also enjoyed discovering the Borough Market & impressive Southwark Cathedral just over the road. And all for bargain prices which we certainly have not enjoyed on previous trips to London.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our weekend stay at this hotel as it was comfortable, quiet, with friendly staff and a good continental breakfast. Every room has a flat screen TV giving an excellent picture and coverage (see picture). We booked the room though Skoosh at very reasonable rates. The location was idea for visiting the Tate Modern with numerous bars, pubs and good restaurants locally. We liked the George Inn round the corner for George Inn ale and The Horniman At Hay’s for Timothy Taylor Landlord. The hotel is also located in close proximity to the London Bridge underground station making it very convenient for trips along the Thames, upstream to St Pauls and downstream to Greenwich.
reviews.title: Thames and the Tate

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for two nights. When I was making a reservation this hotel was rated, if I am not wrong, as a 4-star hotel, now I can see only 3 stars.
reviews.title: Highly recommended hotel only if you get a good deal

reviews.text: My personal opinion it worths about 4 stars. A little bit overprised, but it has clean rooms, very confortable beds, pillows, flat TV, clan bathroom. Nice restourant downstairs.
reviews.title: Could do better

reviews.text: On check-in they required to make a copy of my passport - very unusual. They explained it's the low, however I stayed night before at Heathrow hotel and nobody asked me about the passport.
reviews.title: great hotel excellent location
Amazing, even without the free upgrade! Stayed 10/6/06 (10th June 2006)
reviews.text: Right where to start? After I made the booking, I e-mailed the hotel having read some reviews on TA, as it was recommended that I try to get one of the renovated rooms (particularly as I was taking my partner away for a treat). Well, the lady who replied told me I didn't need to worry, as the refurb was now complete.

When we got there however, after we'd checked in (quick, efficient and polite), the lady on reception said "It's says here you've been upgraded, you're in 518". This turned out to be the best Superior Double on the top floor with a great view over the city (penthouse, to all intents and purposes). It turns out this extra effort on the part of booking staff is typical of the attitude of the entire hotel. Lots of little things have a cumulative effect, and led to a great stay.
reviews.title: The best hotel in London?

likes.disliked: — Not the best views but then I didn't go to London to sit looking out of the window!

reviews.title: Enjoyable London experience, a real find
reviews.text: The room was fantastic and air-con was very welcome. It was clean, tidy, nice and had a sharp modern look without being clinical. Free reading material was great, as was fruit and bottles of water (London was sweltering near the 100F mark whilst we were there), along with obligatory tea and coffee making facilities. Bathroom was small but perfect for its function and again, with really neat, contemporary designs. Big plasma TV too, which is a great space-saving idea.

This is an independent hotel, and wasn't the cheapest around but we did get a really good deal online. Probably, it cost 10% more than for an equivalent room with a large hotel-chain, but the difference from other hotels we've been to in London (and we're there frequently) made the extra cost totally insignificant.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay

reviews.text: Really, in London, you won't find anything else like this for the price, and the service is something you'll be hard pressed to find anywhere in London, for any price - it's so often the thing you can't account for before going.
reviews.title: Good Overall Experience

reviews.text: I stayed in early October for 5 nights.
reviews.title: Excellent - Good well rounded ,great value hotel

reviews.text: I really could not fault the hotel - Rooms were a fair size for london, Plasma/LCD TV in the room, internet access (broadband) - alas it was charged, king sized bed.
reviews.title: London Bridge is falling down

reviews.text: Light Bright, and with a desk. The hotel shower was decent and the staff were friendly.
reviews.title: Not that great
Luxury and convenience
reviews.text: Locationwise can't be beat - 150 metres to London Bridge British Rail/Underground. Close to London Borough Market which is we worth a visit when it is open.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will stay there again!
reviews.title: I beg to differ

reviews.text: I loved my stay at the London bridge hotel over the weekend for my 21st birthday.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel + amazing service = amazing birthday!!

reviews.text: Apon arrival, all the staff gave a warm, friendly welcome and made you feel like the most important person there!
reviews.title: Neglectful bar staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room size was to be expected for central London, however it was very clean and well decorated.
reviews.title: Superb in every way!

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is perfect, a minute from the shard, underground and bus station, and the Thames.
reviews.title: Good location for business in the City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at breakfast and dinner was faultless and the staff were more than happy to deal with any specific requests, nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: A Perfect Hotel & Location

reviews.text: Based on the reviews here we chose our hotel, and were very pleased with it. The location was great for being accessible to the trains and tube. The staff were very pleasant. We weren't able to check in early, like we had hoped, but were able to check our bags so we could head out sight-seeing. We didn't expect a large room, and it wasn't, but it was fine. The bed was very comfortable (and I'm extremely sensitive to bad beds). The continental breakfast was enough, so we weren't starting the day hungry.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay there again

reviews.text: I checked all the different reservation sites, and ended up going with one that was recommended in another review... hotelsrus
reviews.title: Excellent London hotel in good location

reviews.text: A group of us visited London in January and were lucky enough to get a great rate at the London Bridge Hotel.
reviews.title: smart room excellent location

reviews.text: The hotel is located across the road from London Bridge Bus\Rail station. It is minutes walk from Tower Bridge and the Tower of London.
reviews.title: A tight squeeze

reviews.text: Check in at the hotel was handled professionaly by a pleasent staff member. Early check in was no problem.
reviews.title: Excellent as usual

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at London Bridge Hotel for one January weekend back in 2006. I would definitely stay at London Bridge Hotel again. actually I would say it's a real find.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: + Great location, 5 minutes to the underground
reviews.title: Terrible Bed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: + Nice & well kept room..comfy beds.
reviews.title: excellent value and service

reviews.text: + Clean bathroom
reviews.title: Love the London Bridge Hotel.

likes.liked: — The size of the hotel, and the cleanliness.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Poor service. Or then we were just unlucky. Service at the reception definitely below average.
reviews.title: The best deal in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trawled Tripadvisor for a suitable hotel for a two night stop-over visiting family in the South East. Found the London Bridge Hotel with such super reviews, then took a look at their website and it looked great. Upon arrival, there was no disappointment. The hotel and room was better than anticipated. The bed so comfortable that it was difficult to leave it in the mornings. The stay was helped by beautiful weather and the situation is certainly great for walks in both directions by the Thames and very handy for transport.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel to be very clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: very handy

reviews.text: When we first checked in we found the room assigned to be extremely small, we found that 2 suitcases took up all the floor space in the room when standing upright! We requested a larger room, and within 15 minutes were given a larger room which was just perfect for a 5 day stay.
reviews.title: Could have been better for 4 star hotel

likes.liked: — Location to Thames for easy access to 02/excel
likes.disliked: — Access to room, disappointing view, no morning paper and poor breakfast

reviews.text: The beds are extremely comfortable, the location is quiet, even though beside a railway station, and the breakfasts are substantial. Not much of a view though!
reviews.title: Excellent Service & Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this to anyone who wants to be close to the City, the Globe theatre, or Guys Hospital.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for a two night stay to go to the Motor Show and Kylie at 02. Upon check-in we were allocated a room in the "new wing" on the second floor which we thought would be of benefit to us! Sadly this involved a long trip with heavy bags as the lift didn't go to the second floor of the new wing. The room was very modern but our view was sadly over the nearby Tower Bridge station and was very noisy - we thought we might get a river view but no. I ordered a morning newspaper which didn't show on the first morning and enquired at reception who said that they would get it sorted and wouldn't charge me. By the same evening the newspaper had still not arrived and by the next morning that day's paper didn't arrive either which was a big disappointment. The breakfast was quite limited and it was situated in the smallest room ever. Both mornings we were sat virtually on top of the next tables which is a little bit close for comfort first thing in the morning with people you didn't know. The location of the hotel was good to get on to the Thames Clipper boats and to the tube station. All in all we were very disappointed with the hotel and thought that a 4 star hotel would have given better service and we won't be staying there again.
reviews.title: a treat

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a Friday night - it was excellent. The staff were really friendly (which I always think can make up for any shortcomings) - but there weren't any shortcomings. The room was spotless, very comfortable and with a rather good flat screen telly.
reviews.title: Really good.
Style and Smile
reviews.text: Really handy - 20 secs from London Bridge tube (but airconditioned with soundproofing) , overall an excellent stay and would absolutley recommend it.

reviews.title: Excellent, but expensive
reviews.text: There's a Malaysian restaurant too, didn't try it but it looked nice and you get 20% off food if you are staying at the hotel.

reviews.title: Great hotel, great location
reviews.text: A family event in the area made the London Bridge Hotel first choice for accommodation,for position and to avoid the frightful anonimity of many chain hotels.

We had one of three self contained apartments in a unit adjacent to the main hotel. Reception in the smart classical lobby was friendly and efficient and the ever pleasant Omar showed us to our apartment. There were two bedrooms, very comfortable & well equipped, one being fully en suite and large enough to swing a giraffe around if you were so inclined. A double fold out bed in the lounge meant six adults could live comfortably in this apartment. Even with the bed out, there was enough room for said giraffe to invite its friends round and practice long putts on the acres of carpet. Although golf clubs were not provided, the decent sized kitchen was fully equipped for any culinary exercise and there was a small dining area adjacent. The lounge boasted a huge multi channel LCD TV, DVD player and computer links, and each room had a hand controller for air conditioning. The general decor was varied & comfortable, with plenty of lighting options.A second bathroom took care of the needs of those who didn't get the master bedroom. Nature usually dictates a certain amount of contemplation time in a bathroom and I have come to use this time to assess my surroundings as a measure of how much a hotel really cares. I was amazed to find out the in-house maintenance team was responsible for the neatest fittings and fiinishing I have seen in a hotel. I know, I need to get out of the bathroom more. (But if you need your bathroom re-doing.......) The whole stylish effect was kept spotless & tidy by happy chatty Audrey, a sort of Caribbean feng szui practitioner without the serious bits, just right. ( I have experienced the opression of feng szui hotels which take themselves too seriously!) The hotel location is ideal for all transport links within London, and the immediate area is full of interest and vitalising regeneration, giving the riverside new appeal and buzz. We tended to eat al fresco while exploring so can't comment on the hotel dining experience, but if our apartment is a reflection of the hotel's philosophy you can enjoy comfortable style at reasonable cost.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here a couple of Saturdays ago - absolutely lovely hotel - we were told we had been upgraded to a suite when we arrived - it was enormous and a real treat.
reviews.title: Great stay!
Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great area - especially good to go out and about in Borough Market in the evening.
Would happily stay here again
reviews.title: London Bridge Very nice choice!
Great Hotel in Stunning Location
reviews.text: Oh and the staff were really good too - very friendly, professional and polite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfectly located for London Bridge Station/tube, The Shard, and Borough Market (will be even better when new station entrance opens shortly). Great for us as we were going to the National Theatre - walked both ways along the river (25 minutes slow walk). Following night dined at a restaurant overlooking Tower Bridge (10 minute maximum walk along river).
reviews.title: Welcoming and very Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife & I recently stayed at the London Bridge Hotel for 3 nights on a short trip to Europe. Its immediate proximity to the London Bridge Station made it convenient for us to use the Underground to connect to wherever we wanted to go in London. The full breakfast provided was very good each day, staff we talked to were helpful with questions concerning restaurants & transportation, & we appreciated the free wifi access. There is not an abundance of good restaurant options in the immediate area & the room was small, but it was well-appointed & clean, & did not detract from our pleasant stay considering we only spent our time in the hotel to sleep or make a change of clothes. It was definitely a fine value for the price paid & we would choose it again in the future.
reviews.title: Great Underground access and value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideal location for Borough Market a must visit for anyone.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Great Position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bus, Train and Tube all very local.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, prime location, we'll definately be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plenty of Restaurants near by.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel would definitely recommend!

reviews.text: Hotel newly refurbished to a good standard.
reviews.title: I wouldn't call this a 4 star

reviews.text: Our stay was most enjoyable. The rooms were comfortable and very clean. The staff were courteous and friendly. English breakfast was delicious and certainly set us up for the day! Have stayed here twice already and would certainly return again.
reviews.title: A lovely weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stopped here for May Day weekend with my girlfriend. Excellent location next to London Bridge Station and Borough Market, just down from Tower Bridge and a short walk to The Globe, Tate Modern, etc. Lovely room, modern, comfortable and very clean and reasonable size for London.
reviews.title: Great hotel for London weekend break

reviews.text: Great service throughout, excellent meal and good value food in the attached Malaysian restaurant.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay!

likes.liked: — No surprises! Nice room, nice bathroom, good buffet breakfast, nice location....
likes.disliked: — Beds were a bit soft, especially the pull out sofa bed.

reviews.text: The only issue is finding the hotel. Basically turn into the station approach and come through the taxi rank. It feels as though you shouldn't be doing this but it is ok and is the only way to get to the hotel.
reviews.title: Good Deal, Great Hotel

reviews.text: Would certainly stay here again in the future.
reviews.title: Lovely but stay away from Room 102!

reviews.text: My husband and I and our two teens (12 and 14) stayed here for a long weekend in London.
reviews.title: Greta London Base

reviews.text: We stayed in The London Bridge Hotel for 1 night in June and wished we could have stayed longer.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic Hotel!!!!
Very Nice
reviews.text: Everything about our stay there was impresive, the staff, the room and the location.

reviews.title: Great except breakfast
reviews.text: The room was beautifully furnished-very modern and stylish and had everything we would have expected in a 5 star hotel (and it felt like a 5 star). The bed had the biggest, fluffiest white quilt and pillows on it that made us want to stay in and watch the plasma tv all evening.

reviews.title: Overnight stopover
reviews.text: The staff were all very client serviced focussed (and I work in client service so can be quite picky about service), the staff on the concierge desk were always willing to help and always did so with a smile.

The location was close to the underground so was not difficult to get to and as per the name, is right near the London Bridge and the Tower Bridge (which I always thought was London Bridge but I digress).
reviews.title: Good location, helpful staff

reviews.text: Stayed at the London Bridge Hotel on Business for a couple of nights and before arriving was keen to find out what the #6 top rated hotel in London according to Trip Advisor was like.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Stay in London
excellent experience
reviews.text: I was not disappointed, from check-in to check-out the experience was fantastic.

Check-in was a breeze and I was allocated Room 119, which was a nice sized room considering it's London. I've been to plenty of other Hotels in London and they normally pack you in a 'Box Room'. The size of this room enabled it to fit two extremely comfy single beds, a desk and chair, spacious cupboards and a nice large LCD Television on the wall. Decour was also nice and the room was very clean. Although room faced the main road, the double glazed windows did their job and kept out any unwanted traffic noises during the night.
reviews.title: A touch of class
Great value hotel
reviews.text: Aside from the Room description, the rest of the hotel was nicely laid out. The restaurant, which I used for breakfast was good offering a nice array of food to start off your day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is just around the corner from London Bridge Railway/Underground Station and it's easy to get into the heart of London via many modes of transport during your stay.
reviews.title: Good value hotel at the right rate

likes.disliked: — Sparkling rather than still water in the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wanted to write a review due to reviews I read before my arrival on how noisy it was. Our room was facing the front of the Hotel and I heard nothing, completely quite. Concierge Phillipe was extraordinarily helpful. Great location for access to the tube. Room was a little small but nice and clean. Our breakfast was included and was very good.
reviews.title: Fabulous Concierge. Quiet Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted a hotel convenient for the Shard, and other than sleeping IN the Shard, could not have got much closer. This is virtually at the foot of it, so very well placed. Check-in was efficient and quick, and we got an upgrade from a standard room to an executive room, just because we asked! The Concierge service is good, efficient and friendly. The room was spacious, quiet (even thought faced the street), well equipped and extremely clean. The bathroom was spotless, though beware the hot water - it's scaldingly hot if you're not careful. Toiletries are good quality (The White Company), there is an excellent array of magazines, plentiful wardrobe and drawer space and a very comfy, huge bed. Bedlinen was spotless and very comfortable. Breakfast, which was included, was also excellent, with a nice selection of hot and cold food, good coffee and a huge pot of tea. The service was especially good; often breakfast service isopropyl, with empty dishes left lying on the table but not here - they were cleared away immediately efficiently, quietly and by very friendly staff. The maitre'd even did a little "taadaa" as he showed us to our table! All in all, a really nice hotel, and at £145 for bed and breakfast, excellent value.
reviews.title: Great location, good value

reviews.text: We stayed at our usual London Bridge Hotel last weekend and were delighted once again. Friendly and helpful staff at reception, superb concierge, smart and ultra clean rooms, a really comfortable bed, great breakfast with friendly staff once again and an ideal location just a two minute walk from london Bridge station (direct train from Gatwick - no need for the expensive Gatwick express to Victoria). Full marks again london Bridge Hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent once again

reviews.text: This is the 5th time myself and a group of friends have stayed at the hotel. As always the hotel was clean. The reception staff , the concierges and the restaurant staff who were on duty during breakfast were polite and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. However the staff who worked in the bar could do with having some customer service training. We went in the bar for a drink after a day out to decide where we would eat and were thinking of staying in the hotel for a meal. We sat down only to be moved by the barman, we had overhead the manager saying he was to move us out of the way!! We moved to a different area. We then went to order our drinks, there were other guests by the bar ordering drinks too. The waiter waved to us to sit down and someone would get our drinks order. By this time we had got the distinct feeling that they did not want us in their bar. OK we were not dressed in cocktail attire but it was only 6 pm and we only wanted one quick drink. We eventually received or drinks and also the bill with an additional £4 service charge when we were more than willing to fetch our own!!! We will visit the hotel again but will steer well clear of the bar.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel....shame about the attitude of the bar manager and staff

reviews.text: We've just returned from a one night stay with some friends and wouldn't hesitate to use the London Bridge again. It's only a couple of minutes walk to the Thames South Bank and around 15 - 20 minute leisurely walk to Leicester Square for the theatre show we'd booked. Our room was spotless and the bed was huge and very comfortable. We paid the extra for a breakfast which although is a buffet service, was all freshly cooked and of a good quality with plenty of choice.
reviews.title: Great Hotel..!
Loved the London Bridge Hotel
reviews.text: Recently returned from 6 nights at the London Bridge Hotel. As others have mentioned the Hotel rooms are on the smallish side but this is London. The rooms were very clean and the service was first rate. The Hotel is located a stones throw from the tube which made travel a breeze. For the $$, I would happily recommend this to others. Thanks TAers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 7 nights as part of a BA vacation package. We selected the hotel because of all the great reviews and asked BA to package for us. We used miles for one ticket and the BA vacation package for the other. This was our first time to the UK and we thoroughly enjoyed the trip. We used the underground, buses, and trains a lot, so the close proximity to all was a huge plus. Also, the convenient litle shops in the train station came in very handy. The English breakfast was huge by our standards and this kept us pretty full until afternoon tea. The concierge was most helpful, as we had MANY questions. We would like to come back as soon as possible and stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a good rate on the room through an internet site (£80 for a double for 1 night from memory); however you get what you pay for in London in relation to size. Our room was very nice - decor, style, flat screen cable TV, etc - however it was fairly small. But then this is a London 3-star hotel (would be 4-star if it had a bar).
reviews.title: Nice room and location, but no bar

reviews.text: All rooms have a mini-bar, although rather confusingly it had bottled beers but no bottle opener - reception did come and give us one very quickly though.
reviews.title: excellent hotel, location ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bar wise - there isn't one in the hotel - at least not that we could find. There is a bar next door (All Bar One) if you like that sort of thing, or your best off heading out somewhere close by (Butlers Wharf, Southbank, Borough High St) or further afield. Borough Market is about a 2 minute walk from the hotel and good for out-of-towners to go to and experience.
reviews.title: Stylish, modern and friendly hotel, convenient location - great value for money!

likes.liked: — The excellent location and the friendly and professional staff
likes.disliked: — The room temperature on the first night (but this was quickly rectified)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have now stayed at this hotel twice and I have recommended it to friends. This is probably one of the best hotels I have stayed at in London. I really don't want to tell everyone this in case I can't get a room there should I be in London again, but I really can't fault it. It is clean, modern, very helpful staff, great breakfast, and really handy for the borough market. Some people may be put off by the location - next to a train station and not exactly in the centre of London, and a fair distance from the theatre and shopping districts as it's on the south of the river near HMS Belfast and London Bridge (not to be confused with Tower Bridge, the one the tourist want to visit). The surrounding area is also rather dark at night and not very well lit . But the surrounding pubs are rather good and atmospheric - and good if you like real ale! If you don't mind being further out of the city, I really cannot recommend this hotel enough.
reviews.title: London's Best Kept Secret

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just returned from a trip to London with my boyfriend where we stayed at the London Bridge Hotel, taking advantage of their special O2 package, this cost £120 per night per room and included full English breakfast (which was excellent, buffet hot food, pastries etc) and return tickets to the arena by Cattamaran boat. The hotel is in an excellent location, very near to London Bridge tube, right across the road from Borough market which is worth a look. Overall a good trip to London!
reviews.title: Perfect for the 02 arena

likes.disliked: — Warm in the evenings, air con not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned from my third stay at the London Bridge and once again I am very impressed. Great location, rooms small but chic, staff excellent (all of them) and a decent breakfast to boot. If you are going to London and want a good hotel at a decent price this is the place. Finally the mini bar prices are reasonable too. I paid just £16 for a half bottle of Taittinger champagne, same price as the local supermarket!!!
reviews.title: Never fails to impress

reviews.text: I recently stayed here with a friend in a 2-twin bed room. The room itself was lovely and quiet. The front desk staff were friendly and professional, and the concierge gave great food recommendations. Also, wireless internet access is now free!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great City Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Outside of a great room for a really reasonable rate (given that this is London), the real "gem" of this hotel is its location. It's just down the street from the London Bridge tube station, and is within walking distance of major attractions! Taking the Underground's Piccadilly and Jubilee lines has you going to or from Heathrow to the hotel in under an hour!
reviews.title: A great find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay here and I wouldn't stay anywhere else in London.
reviews.title: Great again!

likes.liked: — The massive comfy bed we got

reviews.text: The rooms have all been refurbished since last year, and they look great. The breakfast has also improved slightly (although there wan't much wrong with it before), although bigger glasses for juice would be welcome!
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Great Weekend!
reviews.text: Only a few seconds from the underground, Borough Market and the footpath along the Thames. Only 10 mins on the tube to Bond Street.

reviews.title: London Bridge made our London experience
reviews.text: Plenty of places to eat nearby and small grocery shops/newsagents if you want to avoid using the minibar.

The London Bridge is not very special, room are what you could expect in this price range. Beds are ok but I had a problem with the (very) soft pillows. During the night I found out that I could not open my window, so it was a bit hot in my room (I don't like to sleep with air conditioning during night) Staff is extremely helpful, I didn't manage to open the door of my room (my fault) and they immediately helped me out.
reviews.title: Average but good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have to stay at this side of London, the location is very convenient, London Bridge station (tube,train) is around the corner.
reviews.title: Great Location, clean spacious rooms, very nice hotel

reviews.text: There is some construction work going on during daytime in front of the hotel, but that didn't bother me at all (I requested a room at the back of the hotel, but a colleague who stayed in a room facing the construction told me that you could hardly hear anything)
reviews.title: Great value, Great location, Great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great and ideal for walking or travelling around london. literally 2 minutes from thetube and main line station at London bridge yet the hotel is quiet and very comfortable. Also situated rigt next to Bank and all the restaurants and pubs and cafes along the riverbank. Staff were polite and service was good--- very willing to help in any way. We had an automatic upgrade as our room was not quite ready--- very nice room--- spacious and exceptionally clean--- good amenities and great views. Lovely very large bed and really comfortable--- had great nights sleep. Would definately recommend this hotel for couples and families. Very good value
reviews.title: Easy to find..close to rail..good pricing

reviews.text: I confess that it was my parents that stayed here, but I came each day to collect them and I and my parents were very impressed. Yes there is building work going on across the street but at the weekend there was certainly no disturbance. You are next to a rail station but again my parents did not report any noise.
reviews.title: Major Noise Problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed one night, but very impressed. Checked us in early with an upgrade to executive room. Bedroom was clean, well appointed (huge bed), and very quiet (especially considering the hotel's proximity to London Bridge train station and the buses passing directly by). Tea making equipment, ironing board and bottled water supplied in room were nice touches. Staff were friendly and efficient, and buffet breakfast was nice (our room rate said continental breakfast included, but full English was on the buffet so that's what we had). A very comfortable stay, difficult to think of anything they didn't get just right.
reviews.title: Hard to fault

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked the hotel based on strength of the TA site. Hotel is in an ideal location (although it may not seem like it). At least 5 pubs within walking distance, the underground close by (noise not an issue) Vinopolis and the Borough Market (which may be pushed out of the location). Post office and convenience stores close too.
reviews.title: Good Hotel - May 17-24

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a bit pricey if you want the extra room, but the free bottled water and fruit is a nice touch. We also had breakfast included which was nice, but the fare does not change at all from day to day.
reviews.title: Nice, simple, reasonably priced

reviews.text: Didn't really feel that I had much interaction with the staff. They really kept to themselves. They left room service in our room (champagne and etc.) on accident which we were good enough to tell them about which they came and collected for a different room, but not even a call to say thank you for catching their error and saving them.
reviews.title: Great weekend at the LBH

reviews.text: This was our second time in London and we decided to stay 10 days and really get to see as much without running around. The hotel was super easy to get to. We flew into Luton Airport, which is about 40 miles north of London and took the train into London. Our train station was a block away from the hotel, and a block away from the tube. The rooms although small were sufficient. Service was prompt and courteous. Amenities were a little sparse but it was nice having the ability to make tea or coffee in the rooms and purchasing some muffins etc for breakfasts. Their moderately priced restaurant was good, but got boring after the 3rd day of the same items on the buffet. All in all this was a great value, for clean modern rooms. The only negative I could see was that they charged about $15 USD, per day for Internet access. That was one way to get me not to worry about my emails for a week! I would return, so it was enjoyable.
reviews.title: All round fanatstic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I do not have a bad word to mention about this hotel, great location, friendly staff who would do anything for you, superb rooms and the quality of the furnishings is something else for a hotel of this class and price.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recomend this hotel to anyone, and as for the breakfast a continental is included of which you can help yourself to anything you please and only a fool would go hungry.
reviews.title: Very lovely small hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will certianly be using this hotel for my future stays in london.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Good staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased with the very pleasant and courteous staff at this hotel. The contemporary decor was very pleasing, although the seating in the lobby was not very comfortable. The Deluxe King room was spacious and very comfortable. A full breakfast came with the room, which was very good in selection and taste. We also had dinner one night in the restaurant and found the food, presentation, and service to be better than average for a hotel resturant. We enjoyed having the London Bridge Train Station nearby, in fact that was one of the reasons we booked this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The London Bridge Hotel was a great find - we have been to London a number of times and have not previously found a Hotel which fits all our needs so we have never been back to the same Hotel twice.
reviews.title: Excellent London Base

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The London Bridge Hotel will now become our favorite and we will certainly be back next time we are in London.
reviews.title: The staff are a credit to the hotel

likes.disliked: — The view of the back of London Bridge would only suit trainspotters!!!

reviews.text: As with most reasonably priced London Hotels the rooms are not large however they are comfortably modern and well decorated . - flat screen TV, very comfortable bed and spotless up to the minute en suite.
reviews.title: Fantastic London Hotel!

likes.liked: — That it is welcoming and comfortable
likes.disliked: — There hasn't been anything that Ive least liked!

reviews.text: Breakfast was included in our room rate and the range of choices extensive and enjoyable.
reviews.title: Great bed, nice decor

likes.liked: — Comfortable bed, nice decor, quiet room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our initial concern when we booked it was that it was the "wrong" side of the River - however we soon discovered on arrival that the London Bridge area is a busttling and interesting area with plenty of choices for dinning and quick snacks .
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Thank you London Bridge Hotel for looking after My 30 International guest, and especially my 88 year old mum.
reviews.title: Thank you

reviews.text: I only stayed here for one night. I had a small room that was exceedingly ordinary. The bathroom was basic. The room looked out on to another building. No complaints but for £200 I thought it was only adequate.
reviews.title: Nothing special
Very good
reviews.text: A very nice hotel have stayed over 3 different times, the food is lovely the rooms a good comfortable size!! Staff very helpful and friendly! Returning again in feb! The hotel is clean, and bright- the shower is good- we even have drinks from mini bar- not to pricey!! Short walk from tube station!

reviews.title: Excellent again
reviews.text: Second visit this year to the London bridge and it was just as good this time. Clean and comfortable rooms in a perfect location. All of the building work has been completed outside now which makes it even more pleasant and I can't think of a higher quality hotel in Central London at such a reasonable price. An excellent choice every time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A really good hotel, with friendly helpful staff, after an initial hiccup with our 1st room where there was leaking water onto clothing in the wardrobe. We had a back room, which was good in that the nights were quiet. Staff were very helpful, food was good and best of all it was close to public transport. The big downer was that the taxi driver that we got from Heathrow did not speak English and had no idea where he was taking us. It took 3 hours to find the hotel, and we ended up giving the driver instructions (albeit with our limited knowledge of London). The hotel staff organised our return trip to Heathrow and it only took 40 minutes. This was our 4th stay in London, and as far as hotels go, it is the best that we have had.
reviews.title: The best stay we have had in London
Awesome service
reviews.text: Hello

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is great value. The location is great for Wembley or the O2 as well as only a short walk or tube ride to the west end. The bar was suprisingly well priced and the staff were very good. I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: great location, great service

reviews.text: Overall a great stay, my husband and I were there for a weekend for my 30th birthday. The room and bathroom were very small, but the bed very comfortable. Very clean. There is a few comments on here about the noise from the works across the road, however we found that the double glazing was substantial enough to keep the noise out and the air con cools the room well. The concierge was not at his post a lot and when we ordered a cab he did suggest that we walked across the road to the station to get one, but when we said no he did oblige. It's in a great area and very accessible via taxis with the average cost around £15 to get to main points of intrest. I would definatly stay again but probably would avoid drinking in the bar as it's very expensive, however everything is nearby so there isn't an issue there.
reviews.title: Great stay - with a few niggles.

reviews.text: I contacted this hotel in advance because I needed to stay here over night before going to the hospital the next day. The check in time is later , but the helpfull staff had my room ready when I arrived at 12h00 and I could just go to my room. The hotel is just accross the street from the London Bridge station. It takes exactly 45mins with an overland train from Gatwick airport and costs about £9.45 single trip to get here. It is a very quick way into London and you are immediatly by the station and also the London Dungeon which is next door to the station and several art galleries within walking distance and ofcourse the Thames is right there. The London Bridge hospital is also nearby, only to cross the road and you are there, handy for people having hopsital appointments here who have to fly from further afield. The hotel was clean and the rooms of normal size. Not too large. I had a standard room, cost of about £114 withou tax added. I found this reasonable for the location. There was building works but I was there on a weekend and I could not hear much noise , I suppose on a weekday this may be diffrent and I do not think that the constrtuction will continue forever, it is just unfortunate for the people who are caught at this time. The service was very efficient and the staff very helpfull and professional. I really could not fault the excellent service. I also had room service and I found the food fresh and arrived within no time 15mins at best. The room had a bar fridge and bottled water on arrival. TV and telephone/wifi etc. I found this all very good value
reviews.title: Reasonable Hotel in convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights, was given a free upgrade to a lovely room. Excellent service.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Comfortable beds. Good breakfast. Ideal for London Bridge Underground Station.
reviews.title: excellent
Great Hotel & Location
reviews.text: I'm now planning my seventh visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved everything about this hotel. Very comfortable, clean and the staff were more than helpful. The bed was one of the most comforatble I've slept in and the breakfast choice was extensive. Yes the rooms are smaller than average, but beautifully furnished. We had dinner in the restaurant and the menu choice, service and food was of high quality. The White Company toiletries were an added bonus, and the close proximity to the underground was very convenient.
reviews.title: Absolutely .........................

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the LB for three nights last week and it does what it says on the box. It is worth paying the money for the new rooms which run from x21 to x30.
reviews.title: Almost very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives
reviews.title: great hotel! Bad fire alrm system!

reviews.text: These are among the largest rooms you will get for your money at this class of hotel in London. Clean bright and airy with an absolutely huge bed and great linen. Lots of wardrobe and cupboard space. Good writing desk with network node if you want to work.
reviews.title: Great hotel both for business or pleasure
Lovely London Bridge
reviews.text: Good clean bathroom, complimentary bathrobes and slippers, first class towels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good location 2 min. walk from the tube station. While the room was not very big it had all the luxuries being very clean and comfortable with all the facilities. Staff were very friendly and I found breakfast a treat which set me up for the days sightseeing.Lots of places to eat and drink at night all within 15 minutes walk along the Thames river side. Highly recommended for quiet comfortable clean place to stay. I intend to return for future trips.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is ideally situated for the 02 arena, just across the road from London Bridge Station. It has recently been refurbished to a high standard. The rooms are modern and well equipped with safe, hairdryer, iron, ironing board, tea and coffee making facilities, minibar, air-conditioning and large lcd tv. The room was spotlessly clean and quiet and the bed was extremely comfortable. Breakfast was a buffet style, with a vast and plentiful array of food. This really set us up for the whole day and we didn't need to eat until the evening. The only down side I would say was the price of drinks at the bar, but this is to be expected in London hotels and there are plenty of bars, pubs and restaurants within walking distance along the south bank of the river if you prefer. I would defintely stay at this hotel in future if I was visiting London, you feel like you are out of the hustle and bustle of Central London without being too far from all the attractions. Highly recommended and very good value for money.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

likes.liked: — The decor, cleanliness and excellent breakfast.

reviews.text: No6 on Trip Advisor at the time, so couldn't believe it when I found it nearly came within budget. Comfortable rooms (and a little more spacious than normal in London!). Good gym facilities, good for travel South (I commuted to Croydon). Food excellent. Much better than hotels I stayed in when tied to the Hyde Park area. Only downside is that it isn't easy to find (coming out of Underground)- shopkeepers hadn't heard of it!
reviews.title: Lived up to its rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is of a superb standard. The rooms were lovely, comfortable and clean. Lovely toiletries and a good range of magazines, robes and slippers added a touch of luxury that was much appreciated.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent with a good range to choose from and well replenished throughout the morning.
reviews.title: The Best Place for relaxing holidays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel from Sept 6-10 and we loved it. The area is very well-located. Walking distance from the tube and several restaurants (even Mc Donalds...if you're craving for fast food or just want a cheap lunch/dinner). Breakfast in the hotel was also good. Our room was just like the candid pictures that someone else took. The bed was very soft (I prefer it to be not so soft but it was still comfortable) and the bathroom was clean and nice. We would stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

likes.disliked: — Booked our room via the british airways website and their rates were cheaper than booking it via the hotel's web site.

reviews.title: A City delight
reviews.text: It was a delight to stay in this Hotel, the staff was pleasant and accomodating. The room was spotless and very comfortable larger than we expected. We had a problem with the safety deposit box, but within an hour of reporting this to reception it was repaired. Although the Dinning area was a little small for the size of the Hotel the food was excellant, again the staff was very polite and obliging. We also thought the site of the Hotel was ideal for traveling around London as the tube station is situated just around the corner, also it is only a short walk to London Bridge, and the Embankment. We will definitely stay at this Hotel again,we would highly recommend it.

we stayed between Sep 8 to 10. the location was great, right next to the London Bridge train station and Tube. close to the Borough market where we got fresh bread and wonderful cheese. lots of fresh produce also.
reviews.title: good place to stay to see the east side of London
Fantastic Stylish hotel in a brilliant location
reviews.text: the bathroom was very small. we had a room with little round window on the 4th floor. the window gave us more privacy, but since we are next to the train tracks, we can hear the wheels squealing when the train goes by.

This hotel is riddeled with bad service,over worked employees, unsantitary restrooms and management that just doesn't care about really being a top class hotel. Don't order a Taxi from the Concieire because your going to pay 50% more than standing outside and hailing one...
reviews.title: You'll need Sherlock Holmes to get the quality and service you deserve ;(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our experience started with an triple taxi fare charged from the airport as we booked it though the hotel and found-out that not only our driver was getting paid, but so was the hotel from our fare,,, 24hr room service didn't exsit, the noise from the construction across the street was constant, Our hotel resturant experince was terrible,,, Really stay some where else you thank yourself later!
reviews.title: What a beautiful place!

reviews.text: I stayed at the London Bridge for three nights on a quick getaway with my wife. The staff was very nice to us - after arriving in the morning from the US, the desk staff tried to get our room prepared early for us so we could freshen up for a day on the town. It was suggested that we grab something to eat at the nearby Borough Market while we waited, so we did. By the time we came back, our room was ready, and it was quite a nice room. Typical for European hotels, it was a small room, but clean and modern and well-kept. The hotel is centrally located - the tube station is right around the corner, suburban trains are across the street, and Borough Market is a block away. Breakfasts were served in the spacious restaurant on the lower level, and the buffet had lots to choose from and was fresh. I honestly have nothing bad to say about this place - everything was more than I had imagined it would be. If you have a choice, pick London Bridge Hotel!
reviews.title: Hotel Fine, Street Noise a Problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in one of the two bedroom apartment rooms in the 'annex' next to the hotel. The hotel rooms were fine, albeit the hot water pressure was a bit low. All the normal mod cons and arctic air conditioning (why does the hotel leave it on 17C?), but all easily changed. The one problem with the room was the old sash windows which did not provide much in the way of sound proofing against the background noise of the city. Whilst normally a heavy sleeper the noise was enough to make sleepinig difficult and then when a water main broke in the small hours and the street was dug up it was impossible. Breakfast was normal buffet style and of a mediocre quality, the eggs were SWIMMING in fat and after a poor nights sleep that's not a pretty sight. If some rooms are better sound insulated this would be a fine hotel to stay in, but I would go out and eat breakfast somewhere on the river bank. If you are a family the two bed apartment rooms may be of interest, as along as the children don't mind the noise. Sadly I won't plan on returning.
reviews.title: An excellent hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the London Bridge Hotel and we were very impressed. It was very close to the nearest underground, and we were able to get there quite easily from Paddington. The hotel itself was very comfortable, we had a great, well appointed room, which was extremely clean. The breakfasts were delicious with lots of choice, from the healthy to the indulgent! The lounge/bar area was very comfortable too.Throughout the hotel, every member of staff that we encountered was exceptionally pleasant and helpful. When we next visit London we will definitely return to the London Bridge Hotel.
reviews.title: You could feel a bit cheated from this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my husband found this hotel superb for the cost and location. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the rooms were really spacious and clean. Its just a stones throw from the Tube station which is really handy. We are going to stop there again for definate for our next visit.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

likes.liked: — Spacious room and closeness to Tube station

reviews.title: Great Value for Money
reviews.text: We had a 3 nights stay which included continental breakfast but when we got to breakfast in the morning we were offered the full works of full english. The only thing was that the food was only warm, but we couldnt complain. There was plenty to choose from including lovely breads.

reviews.title: clean and comfortable
reviews.text: I would advise anyone to stay here, its great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we only stayed one night it was a thoroughly pleasant experience. The staff were courteous and helpful and the room was spotless and very comfortable. In the evening we tried their Malaysian restaurant which was good value for money. Again the restaurant staff were exemplary. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others. Also very conveniently situated for travelling by train.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed with teenage children for weekend. Had rooms next to each other without having to ask. Rooms compact but not a problem, very clean and bed very comfortable. Reception staff very polite and welcoming. Breakfast enough choice and good quality. Would definitely stay here again, it is very close to tube station with minimal noise from trains heard only slightly in the morning.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Nice Staff!

likes.disliked: — Internet and hours of fitness center operation

reviews.title: Doesn't disappoint on 2nd visit
reviews.text: Had a wonderful weekend here, 2nd time I have used the hotel and excellent in every respect. Excellent rooms (especially for the price), friendly helpful staff and good breakfast. Super location for accessibility and exploring this part of London. Don't miss Borough Market on Sat am.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent Hotel with staff always trying to do the best for the clients. Breakfast was lovely, although a little cramped at times. The check in process was fairly straightforward, although a word of Warning. We booked through Skoosh, for a double room, which was confirmed by email, however with a disclaimer based on availability. My only recommendation, if you are two guys and want a twin, or you are with your partner and need a double, use another booking site, that will at least confirm the room you are getting. The hotel staff did their utmost to accomodate us, however the only way we could get a double was to upgrade.
reviews.title: Nice quality hotel
Friendly accomodating staff
reviews.text: Other downsides, it is close to the financial district, which does not open at the weekend, we dashed across to Frasers and M & S on the saturday morning, only to find that they only open through the week.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is obviously not a fault of the hotel, and is only to make other travellers aware. I would definately stay at this hotel again, although would book through another provider or direct with the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect for a romantic weekend

likes.disliked: — Only having one bedside table - picky I know

reviews.text: On booking through a third party we were disappointed that we couldn't be guaranteed a double room on arrival. When we arrived at the London Bridge the staff did their utmost to ensure we had a double room for which we were very grateful.
reviews.title: A regular stay
Relieved it was so nice and in a good London location
reviews.text: We were not sure we had made the right decision about where to stay as London has such a choice and price varies not always with quality as you might expect. We were pleasantly surprised at this reasonably priced, conveniently located, clean, comfortable and efficient hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was as good as the excellent and helpful service.
reviews.title: Brilliant staff, gorgeous hotel!

likes.liked: — The high quality of the room and the general ethos of the hotel

reviews.text: We had to call on maintenance staff as the safe battery had failed - he arrived within 5 minutes, immediately fixed the problem and had gone again after explaining that all was now OK. As we were waiting to go out to the theatre and wanted our valuables stowed away this was a great relief.
reviews.title: Really like the London Bridge Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would recommend this Hotel and will most definitely return again ourselves as we really enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the London Bridge Hotel for his Birthday back in September 06. I had booked this and tickets to see The Lion King (the most amazing musical ever!!) as a surprise. Before arriving I had emailed head conceirge Paul Opray asking if it would be possible to have a birthday cake, balloons and champagne put in our room ready for arrival.Mr Opray was really helpful, he emailed back straight away and made sure everything was ready for when we got there.
reviews.title: A Let Down

reviews.text: The hotel is located right next to the London Bridge tube station or if you prefer you could walk over the bridge and get on the tube at Monuement. Check in was excellent,friendly staff and as our stay was to celebrate our forthcoming wedding we got a free upgrade! this was a double delux and it certainly lived up to its name. Bathrobes, slippers, plaza TV and my favourtive - 'White Company' toilteries.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our booking was for a continental breakfast which had a wide range of choice. The hotel did also have its own resturant whiched looked really nice however we headed to china town-on the guidence of the concierge who recomended the Royal Garden restuarant. Superb food!.
reviews.title: Great hotel on the south bank
Friendly, Comfortable and welcoming
reviews.text: Would definitley recomend this hotel to anyone who wishes to stay in a luxuary hotel,for half the price to those around leicester square and convent garden. Will definitley be booking this hotel again when staying in London.

I scored a great deal for a weekend single in London in the summer (99 GBP for Fri, Sat, and Sun nights, English breakfast included). The hotel is excellent, very comfortable and in a great location. It seems to cater to business travelers, because my rate went up to 162 GBP for Monday night(!). However, it's an excellent choice for tourists on weekend stays.
reviews.title: Great Hotel on South Bank

reviews.text: Wonderfully helpful and friendly staff. Excellent cooked breakfast buffet in the Londinium room. Guest rooms are beautiful. Loved the location. Southwark has a lot of character and off-beat history. Convenience in accessing nearby tube and taxis is a big plus. Great pubs and food nearby. Already looking forward to staying here on our next visit. Curt Carleen and Cheryl Lilienthal, Saunderstown, Rhode Island, USA
reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed staying at the London Bridge Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are a young couple who stayed in this hotel in January 2007. It was the nicest hotel we stayed in on a 7 week trip around Europe. It was really modern, comfortable and clean. The tube was only a 2 minute walk away. The staff were friendly & extremely helpful. The buffet breakfast was delicious . I would definitly stay in this hotel again.
reviews.title: Modern Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a thoroughly enjoyable stay at the London Bridge Hotel. The room was clean and tidy, had satellite TV, kettle, hairdryer, safety deposit box, air con, ample wardrobe space, very comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast was lovely, caters for all taste.Staff very friendly and helpful. 2 mins from LB underground, very convenient. Would definately stay there again, and will recommend to friends.
reviews.title: You CAN hear trains from street side of hotel

reviews.text: We checked in at 11:30 and specifically asked for a quiet room, NOT on the street side of the hotel. Front desk staff said we were all set in that regard, but we couldn't get into the room until 13:00. I asked again, "Not on train side of hotel, correct?" He said room is in the center of the hotel, so it will be quiet.
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay
